attributes.action: Make all incontinence products available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Many people across the UK, of all ages, suffer from bowel or bladder incontinence.
Across many areas, the NHS is lacking options available for people having to live with this condition.
We are offered adult nappies only,when there are other better options such as pull ups. Make those free on NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Bowel or bladder incontinence is a very difficult symptom to deal with. I believe many more adult continence products should be available from the NHS. Different people have different issues, and some products are suited to some, but not others. Give suffers the choice.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all mobility scooter owners have insurance
attributes.background: Scooters are a cheap & affordable means of transport for the elderly & infirm to get about.  With accidents on the rise & with no compulsory insurance required by owners there is very little a member of the public can do to recover compensation when involved in an accident caused by the driver

attributes.action: All bill presented to parliament must be given a vote.
attributes.background: There is increasing unease with the use of filibuster techniques to talk out bills. In addition to being undemocratic this can, rightly or wrongly, give the impression that there is some ulterior motive to blocking a vote. For the sake of transparency all bills must be given a fair vote.

attributes.action: To insist on a 100 year clause in any section 30 order for Scottish independence
attributes.background: David Cameron's government naively took the SNP at their word that the 2014 Scottish Independence Referendum was a, "Once in a generation," Event. It is therefore imperative that any future Section 30 order granted to the Scottish Government for this purpose contains a 100 year, no referendum clause
attributes.additional_details: A 100 year, no independence referenda, clause must be agreed upon to stop the continuous division of Scottish society and to bind participants to the result.

attributes.action: Make Nutrition and Hydration training for workers in the Care Sector mandatory.
attributes.background: Poor provision and delivery of Nutrition and Hydration has long been a contentious issue in the Care Sector. Improving nutrition and hydration training & implementation will not only improve the health and wellbeing of service users but will also have a vast socioeconomic and environmental impact.
attributes.additional_details: The care certificate has a section on fluid and nutrition which can be covered in a 25 minute online course. As the impact of malnutrition and dehydration has such a detrimental effect on service users, families, the staff and costs involved (£19.6 billion per year spent on malnutrition - BAPEN report 2015) the level & amount of training is insignificant in improving the skills and knowledge in terms of the provision & delivery of Nutrition and Hydration to vulnerable people in the care setting.

attributes.action: Make non emergency visits to NHS A&E departments chargeable (like say £10).
attributes.background: What we are hearing is A&E's are used for non emergency cases which could be dealt with by a local GP or by using 111 service. Making people pay a nominal fee would deter them from misusing the great service A&E provides. Also this could help raise funds for much needed NHS services.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pay for parking where you work.
attributes.background: Companies should not make their employees pay for parking where they work, it is unfair and you are basically paying to be at work. Car parks are charging ridiculous amounts which takes a lot of money from your wage at the end of the month.

attributes.action: HGV stay in the inside lane between 6am to 8pm on motorways and dual carriageway
attributes.background: I feel a lot of the congestion caused is by one lorry overtaking another lorry and taking miles to do so , making lorries keep to the inside lane would ease a lot of this it would also save the government and the county a fortune as a lot of the road widening schemes would not be necessary ,

attributes.action: Allow airport staff with a valid ID to carry 2 x liquid bags through security.
attributes.background: Everyone is allowed 1 x plastic bag of liquids 100ml or less weather staff or passengers. However, I would like staff to be allowed 2 x plastic bags of toiletries as this will help with especially Cabin Crew where they have nightstops away and don't want to take a suitcase - PLEASE SIGN & HELP!

attributes.action: Statutory Adoption Allowance for Self-Employed
attributes.background:
Employed people who adopt are entitled to the same 39 weeks paid leave as those who give birth.
Self Employed parents are entitled to 39 weeks maternity allowance. Which amounts to £5,443.62.
A Self Employed parent who adopts receives no statutory allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst some parents may be able to contact the local authority for help this is not in any way guaranteed.
As part of the adoption procedures the prospective parents have their finances inspected and so the majority of parents are reluctant to ask for financial help in fear that it jeopardises their application

attributes.action: Abolish NHS referral system that controls access to private medical treatment.
attributes.background:
The control is costly & unnecessary. Individuals should be given freedom to choose to go to specialists, privately, straightaway if wished.

Benefits: 1. Options to patients; 2. Lesser queue. 3. Free up time & cost from referral mgmt. 4. Promotes healthy competition among private & NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting time for GP appointment. Hospital A&E won't see me as it is not an emergency, however painful. Can't reach specialist doctor privately, without GP referral. Walk-in clinic can't refer. As patient, I suffer until it turns into an emergency. I was willing to pay for my treatment; I had medical insurance. Then why such situation? Sounds familiar? Sign the petition.

attributes.action: Lift the ban of Pit bulls and other dogs affected by BSL in the UK
attributes.background: Many innocent breeds of dogs have been banned from the UK on grounds of them being dangerous - but the animals aren't dangerous and I refuse to allow the government to ban an innocent animal purely because of previous criminal owners forcing them into violence
attributes.additional_details: I know many people are aware of BSL (Breed Specific Legislation) making specifics breeds of dogs banned purely because they could be deemed as dangerous, but I bet you didn't know that in 2015, Jack Russels were the breed most likely to bite in the city of Liverpool (according to police in Liverpool). Furthermore, your household best friend - the Labrador - is also responsible for the highest number of canine attacks according to the pet insurers Animal Friends.

attributes.action: A parking bay should have legal standard size of 3 meters
attributes.background: Parking bays are too small and you can't get out you car once parked. I'm disabled and find it hard to get out my car when I can't find a disabled parking bay, because they're all taken. I'd like to see a legal minimum size bay of 3 meters since most car parks charge

attributes.action: Use UK National Lottery to support the NHS and Care homes.
attributes.background: It's distressing to read and hear about the problems with our NHS services and the closures of Care Facilities and Homes for the Elderly, such distress can only continue for so many if these problems persist.
attributes.additional_details: Alternatively, why also doesn't the government introduce a NHS Lottery which is solely for the running of the NHS and associated causes like care for the elderly?

attributes.action: Pay off all NHS PFI's outstanding, raised by this and previous governments.
attributes.background: PFI's raised by previous governments means that the NHS is paying off enormous interest at rates agreed by those governments and not by the NHS. Our taxes which should be going to the NHS are being used to pay off these interests instead of being used to cure the patients.
attributes.additional_details: John Major started the NHS PFI's and Blair/Brown continued to use them as a way to build hospitals with no cost to the government. The cost is being born by the NHS, on which these contacts were forced, and it is our money that is being used to pay off the eye watering interest payments.

attributes.action: Charge patients for not attending NHS appointments.
attributes.background: Hundreds of patients miss appointments at local GP's and Hospitals without valid reasons, who then go on to take beds in A&E when they could have been treated at their Doctors or pharmacies. For missing these appointments, without valid reasons, i believe people should pay a fine.
attributes.additional_details: People who fail to turn up or miss appointments at hospitals and local GP's, without valid reasons, should be fined or sent a bill. It is increasingly difficult to get appointments at GP's and the waiting list in Hospitals gets ever longer. By fining these people who waste these appointment not only would you raise revenue which can be invested in the NHS but would make people think twice before avoiding appointments and potentially keeping people out of A&E.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of Fairfield Hospital A & E Dept.
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned demand you stop the proposed closure of the A & E Department at Fairfield General Hospital, Bury, Gt Manchester.
This already overworked A & E serves a population of over 355,000 people from the home town of Bury and the surrounding towns of Heywood, Rochdale & Rossendale.
attributes.additional_details: The nearest A & E’s to these towns if Fairfield closes are Oldham ( approx 12 miles from most homes, Blackburn, 11 miles from Rossendale and North Manchester General,  10 miles)   all of which are completely overstretched due to cutbacks in surrounding areas and virtually inaccessible to anyone without a car.

attributes.action: Save Southport A&E hospital
attributes.background:
Southport A&E hospital is on a list for closing. Think about it..... if you or your family needed emergency care where and how long would it take to get there never mind about being in the nhs queue to receive treatment. 
Please help everyone you know. Let's save southport A&E!!!!!!!

attributes.action: Burglaries should attract a minimum of a five year prison sentence.
attributes.background: Ordinary citizens are having homes and businesses burgled or cars taken under threat of violence. It is time the judiciary put our safety and well-being above the offender. Hand out lengthy prison sentences and provide in-prison rehabilitation programmes to break the offenders criminal cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Then,following prison release criminals should be made to pay for the cost of their prison stay even if they are on benefits. Make them pay a minimum of £5 per week.

attributes.action: Increase NI contributions and % of Gov. spending to meet the demands of the NHS.
attributes.background: The BBC were allowed into A&E depart. of the Royal Blackburn Hospital to witness the desperation of both patients and staff over a week. More investment in staff and accommodation was suggested by a consultant as a way forward. We should pay more for this invaluable institution which we all use.

attributes.action: Delay the Disability benefit cuts due in April 2017
attributes.background: These cuts will have a devastating effect on one of the most vulnerable and needy groups

attributes.action: Introduce a 'political awareness test' to allow minors to qualify for the vote.
attributes.background: This idea arrived after the recent Brexit-Bremain debate when many minors felt their vote would have impacted the descision to stay or leave the European Union. The idea is also inspired by the positive impact 16 and 17 year olds had on the Scottish Refferendum. The test would allow minors to vote.
attributes.additional_details: Introduce a political awareness test which would allow citizens under the age of 18 to vote (after qualifying) in all forms of election across the UK. A test like this would eliminate the argument that minors do not know politics and therefore can't be trusted with the vote. If the minor was to pass the test, proving there awareness of politics, then they would qualify to have the ability to vote in any domestic election before age 18. The default voting age will still remain at 18.

attributes.action: Overhaul the honours system, so only selfless acts of compassion are rewarded
attributes.background: Famous people, people in power and people with money shouldn't get on the honours just because they're in those positions. It's prejudicial. They need to earn it, doing things outside their normal jobs, helping people and the community within our country. Otherwise the honours are meaningless.
attributes.additional_details: The list should be for those who help protect the country and support it outside of their paid duties. Just being rich or doing a job you're paid to do shows innate produce prejudice for the elite. We should encourage compassion and community spirit and love of our country, but the current system teaches us that if you're in the elite, or you're friends with the PM, that's all that matters. It's not supposed to be there as the PM's private thank you card.

attributes.action: Give Au Pairs employment rights in the UK.
attributes.background: Au pairs come to the UK to learn English and experience a new culture living in with a family. In return for ones accommodation, one will help in the home and with the children for a small 'pocket money' token. In reality, this is a job and should have employment rights like all other employment.
attributes.additional_details: The laws for Au Pairs & Host Families need addressing as they are non-existent. AP's can work in excess of 60 hours per week, being paid anything from £35 per week, with no paid holiday or right to minimum wage. The Gov states AP's ''are unlikely to be classed as a worker or an employee.'' But why? A Nanny or cleaner are entitled to employment rights so why not AP's? It will protect both host families and AP's to have employment law to fall back on should either side need it down the line.

attributes.action: Legalisation of Medical and Medicinal cannabis, in the United Kindom.
attributes.background: Report by Adam Smith Institute says UK’s drug strategy ‘has failed in its core aims’ and urges government to legalise cannabis
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis should be legalised in the UK, according to a report that has the backing of several cross-party MPs including the former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg.

Current cannabis policy in Britain is a “messy patchwork” of legislation intermittently enforced by regional police and an embarrassment, says the report by the free-market thinktank the Adam Smith Institute.

attributes.action: License all drone operators in the uk
attributes.background: Many drone owners operate their machines without training, are ignorant of the law and pose a danger to the well being and privacy of the general public. For those reasons they should be trained and licensed before flying these devices.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Body Mass Index (BMI) as a measure of obesity by NHS
attributes.background: Set in 1830 by a non-medical mathematician and astronomer, BMI is an inaccurate measure of body fat content and does not take into account muscle mass, bone density, overall body composition, racial and sex differences. When Johnny Wilkinson won the RWC he was officially overweight according to BMI.
attributes.additional_details: There is an urgent need for accurate tools to measure fat and skeletal muscle, and biomarkers that can better predict the risks of diseases and mortality. Advances to improve the measurement of obesity and related factors will help determine the optimal weight for an individual, taking into account factors such as age, sex, genetics, fitness, pre-existing diseases, as well as novel blood markers and metabolic parameters altered by obesity. (Ahima and Lazar, Science, August 2013)

attributes.action: Temporarily ban breeding of domestic animals until UK pet crisis is manageable.
attributes.background: We believe preventing breeding of domestic animals for monetary gain will decrease the number of animals living in cages. Why when there are so many animals without homes are we letting people keep breeding more?. They clearly have no thought for the animals, just the money they can make.
attributes.additional_details:
It is our societies decisions that have led to the number of abandoned animals increasing year on year. Rescue centres are overwhelmed  and it is our responsibility to change this.
102,363 stray and abandoned dogs were handled by local Authorities between 2014-2015, and the RSPCA alone rescued almost 119,000 animals.

attributes.action: Make it law to wear helmets on bicycles skateboards and roller skates
attributes.background: To many fatal injuries that could be avoided if a helmet was worn
attributes.additional_details: Most children in the UK think it is a bit silly to wear helmets. In New Zealand it is the law to wear safety helmets if you are on any thing with wheels and as it is the law no child seems to mind wearing them.

attributes.action: Force Airlines to offer nut free meals as an option.
attributes.background:
People with nut allergies can die of anaphylactic shock if they ingest nuts. Whilst it is possible to order Kosher, Muslim, Vegetarian, reduced salt etc etc meals. Not one airline will offer nut free meals as an option. 

It should be a legal requirement to make a nut free option available.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a list of the "Special Meal" options from British Airways:-

Type of meal

Lacto-ovo-vegetarian,
Vegan/vegetarian	
Asian/Hindu vegetarian
Muslim 
Kosher
Child meal	
Diabetic
Gluten intolerant	
Low calorie	
Low fat	
Low salt	
Low lactose

The above are meal choices. Yet someone who cannot eat nuts is not catered for. It is unreasonable for people on long haul flights particularly children to be denied safe food to eat.

attributes.action: Change the Discretionary Payment income cap.
attributes.background: The discriminatory payment income cap is much too low. A disabled family on all appropriate benefits falls much higher in income bracket to the aloud £15,000. This is discrimination against severely disabled families, as these people  successfully applied for community care grants and crisis loans.
attributes.additional_details: I myself have spoken to a member of the staff at the Discretionary Payment office and was refused a grant on the basis that my income was too high. The reason for my income being so high was not because of work or anything of the like, was simply because my daughter is so severely disabled and on high rate DLA that she was also entitled to disability component of child tax credit's. That entitlement to the disability component of child tax credit's is what put my and come over.  Discrimination.

attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: UK Government to hand control of the Severn bridges to the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Control of the Severn bridges needs to be handed to the Welsh Assembly, who have unanomously voted to abolish the tolls. This would greatly help the Welsh economy.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes
attributes.background: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: Remove the law that states you must stay in education until you are 18.
attributes.background: In England, you must stay in some form of education until you are 18 years old. I believe this is wrong, as it limits the choice of young people. If this law was removed, everyone would have the ability to do what they want to do after they leave school.
attributes.additional_details: As a college student myself, I understand how many people who are 16 or 17 years old feel. I believe at this age we lack rights. We don't have the right to vote, and we don't have the right to make a choice on our own futures. I feel for many, attending college isn't the right choice, and unless we are able to secure an Apprenticeship, there is no way for us to leave. Personally I find remaining at college difficult, as I would like to seek full time employment, but that choice isn't available.

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: Make the use of automatic renewals for insurance and other services illegal.
attributes.background: Automatic renewals are used extensively in the insurance market. They are not however confined to insurance services, and you may find things such as annual gym memberships and even dating agencies will automatically renew your contract and take money from your account without prior warning.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I've spoken to have incurred bank charges as a result of auto renewal payments being declined due to there being insufficient funds in their accounts. In many instances this is due to those people having no knowledge that a payment was about to be taken without prior warning.

attributes.action: Increase National Minimum Wage to a minimum of £20/£25 per hour.
attributes.background: Increase the National Minimum Wage to a fair and decent level so those at the lower end of the employment ladder don't just have to survive or fight tooth and nail to get by. Instead of giving people 'benefits' like Tax Credits use that money to reduce Business Taxes so employers can cover the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
People would rather earn a decent wage than feel like they have to be supported on benefits by the government.

Reducing business taxes in this way would encourage more business to set up and invest in their companies. Also would encourage more businesses to set up in the UK.

The government spends an estimated £30 billion a year on Tax Credit. Don't give handouts to people give them a decent wage and some pride in themselves.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Ensure every UK home and business has access to a minimum of 2mb broadband.
attributes.background: All UK homes and businesses need access to a minimum 2mb broadband connection in order to benefit from the increasingly digital world. This should be universally completed, at no extra cost to customers, regardless of location and challenges, before any roll out of further improvements elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must introduce legislation to make this a minimum standard for all internet providers to meet.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day 2018 a national holiday
attributes.background: As the 11th of November 2018 will be the centenary of the end of the Great War (WW1) I believe as a make of respect the whole of the UK should have a national holiday to remember the fallen.
